system.description: Inquisitorial rosette relic. Invoke Faith (1/encounter, 10m, warp entities flee 1d5 rounds on WP-20 fail). Holy Radiance (1/day, 20m, 2d10 E ignoring armour to daemons). Passive: +20 WP vs psychic/warp. Against Strahd: 3m exclusion zone, Domination fails in 5m, Regeneration halved in 20m.

Heavily encrypted data-cogitator containing Strahd's personal records spanning centuries. Decryption: Hard (-20) Tech-Use/Cipher. Once decoded: +20 to tests vs Strahd, +10 WP vs his powers, reveals coffin location and three conditions for permanent destruction.
Vostra-crafted talisman. +5 WP vs warp phenomena. Single-use emergency: absorb one psychic attack entirely, then crumbles to dust. Only one active at a time.
Extraordinarily potent alcohol. +10 WP for 1 hour, -10 BS and Ag for 1 hour. If consumed within 1 hour of trauma, remove 1d5 IP (1/day).
Removes 1 level of Fatigue. Tastes of ash and desperation.
Removes 1 Fatigue and grants +5 WP for 1d5 hours. Brewed at Krezk distillery using Sacred Pool water.

Formal letter with Strahd's seal and psychic imprint. Strahd's servitors will not attack the bearer. Hidden cost: functions as psychic beacon â€” Strahd always knows bearer's location and emotional state.

Portable device recovered from Vessel of Lament (LD7). Single charge. Creates 10m warp-ward for 8 hours: no warp phenomena, +20 Corruption Tests, warp-touched creatures -10 all characteristics. One use only.
Bronze censer from Vessel of Lament cargo hold (MD8). 3 charges of sanctified incense. When lit: 5m radius purified air for 10 minutes, +10 WP vs warp phenomena/fear/psychic attacks.

Psychic amplification stone from Vessel of Lament (UD7). +20 to attacks against the altar-engine in LD3. During Phase 2 boss fight: can be activated (Half Action) to dissolve warp-echo cultists, stop room constriction, and deal 2d10 E to the entity. Crumbles to dust after altar destroyed.
Stasis-field-protected data-slate recovered from Vessel of Lament wreckage. Contains Captain Durst's records of Strahd's early rule. +10 to all Common Lore (Barovus) tests for the campaign.
Blessed by a Ministorum saint centuries ago. Three exist, stolen from the Recaf Distillery. Locations: Warp-Tree (Nexus), Baba Lysaga (Berez), Zarovich Spire. Replanting restores Distillery function.
Sanctified by a Ministorum priest. Single-use holy weapon: 1d5 E damage to daemons, ignoring armour. Thrown as a ranged attack (5m range).
